resources.string: In which of the alternatives below does the limit exist?
In which of the alternatives below does continuity exist?
Which of the limits below is/are horizontal asymptote(s)?
In which of the alternatives below does the limit exist?
Solving a derivative by definition is a process of several steps. Which of the options below is the second step of the derivative of \\(f(x) = x^2 - 3x\\)?
What is the equation of the normal line to the curve \\(f(x) = 2x^2+3x\\) at the point \\(x = 2\\)?
The derivative of the function \\(x^2+y^2=4\\) in the implicit form is \\(\\frac{-x}{a}\\). What is the value of \\(a\\)?
Solving the limit \\(\\lim\\limits_{x \\to +\\infty} (1 - \\frac{1}{x})^{2x}\\), we obtain \\(\\frac{1}{e^a}\\). What is the value of \\(a\\)?

A closed cylindrical vessel, in which the height is three times the radius, is increasing in size, causing a change in the radius as a function of time according to the expression \\(r = \\frac{t^2}{3} + 2t\\), the radius given in centimeters.\n\n When determining the rate of change of the total area of the cylinder as a function of time at \\(t = 2s\\), we find the value \\(A\'(2) = \\frac{2560\\pi}{a}\\space cm^2/s\\). What is the value of \\(a\\)?
